meanings.definition: To cover or obscure with clouds.
meanings.sent1: The storm was overclouding the sky, blocking out the sun.
meanings.sent2: The tall buildings were overclouding the view of the mountains.
meanings.sent3: The overclouding mist made it hard to see the path ahead.
meanings.sent4: Her worries overclouding her mind like a thick fog.
meanings.sent5: The smoke from the fire was overclouding the entire neighborhood.

meanings.sent1: The sad news was overclouding his mood for the rest of the day.
meanings.sent2: The overclouding shadows cast a sense of foreboding over the forest.
meanings.sent3: The overclouding weather matched his somber thoughts perfectly.
meanings.sent4: The overclouding night sky seemed to swallow up all the stars.
meanings.sent5: The overclouding presence of the old house gave her chills.

meanings.sent1: Her talent for singing overclouded her other abilities.
meanings.sent2: The loud music overclouded the conversation at the party.
meanings.sent3: His overclouding ego made it hard for others to get along with him.
meanings.sent4: The overclouding influence of the popular kids affected the whole school.
meanings.sent5: The politician's scandal overclouded his previous achievements.
